alert.note: Alert for Amherst (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 30 at 1:56PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Amherst County through 230 PM EDT... At 155 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Lowesville, or near Clifford, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Amherst... Forks Of Buffalo... Clifford... Lowesville... New Glasgow... and Piney River. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning.
